intro: Bromus supernovus, commonly known as the supernova brome, is a flowering plant species native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It is characterized by its tall, slender stalks and small, spike-like inflorescences that bear颖果. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to withstand strong winds and low temperatures. Its genetic makeup includes unique traits that make it resistant to certain pathogens. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
